page.description: Adds fields to a table. New_fields is a crlf list of fields to be added in format: fieldname,type,size,decimals
page.original:
TABLE.ADD_FIELDS() Syntax TABLE.ADD_FIELDS( Table_Name as C, Field_List as C ) ArgumentDescription Table_NameThe name of the table. Field_ListA CR-LF delimited string containing the name and definition of each new field to be added. Each field in Field_List is specified in the format: Fieldname, type, width, decimal_places. The field types, the single character codes used to represent them, and the valid parameters associated with them are: Field TypeType CodeValid Parameters Character"C"Fieldname, Field Type, Width Numeric"N"Fieldname, Field Type, Width , Decimal Width Date"D"Fieldname, Field Type Logical"L"Fieldname, Field Type Memo"M"Fieldname, Field Type Rich text memo"R"Fieldname, Field Type Bitmap"B"Fieldname, Field Type OLE"O"Fieldname, Field Type Linked image"I"Fieldname, Field Type
Description The TABLE.ADD_FIELDS() method adds new fields to an existing table. If Field_List contains a field name that is not unique, then the field name is adjusted so that it is unique. E.g. "name" becomes "name1" etc. All of the existing data in Table_Name is preserved when the new fields are added. Example This script adds several new fields to an existing table. fields = Product,c,20 Price,n,10,2 Notes,m %str% table.add_fields("table1", fields)
See Also Table Functions and Methods, Table_and_Field_Names
